subcategory.name: Calendars
subcategory.description: Calendar examples for Tailwind CSS, designed and built by the creators of the framework.
subcategory.introduction: Use these Tailwind CSS calendar and date picker components to add date selection and scheduling features to your interface. These components are designed and built by the Tailwind CSS team, and include a variety of different styles and layouts.

<!doctype html><meta charset="utf-8"><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, shrink-to-fit=no"><link rel="preconnect" href="https://rsms.me/"><link rel="stylesheet" href="https://rsms.me/inter/inter.css"><link rel="stylesheet" href="/plus-assets/build/iframe/components.css?hash=1907d2476e1de77d68dab0ee685e463a"><link rel="modulepreload" href="/plus-assets/build/assets/iframe-react-C72_0lsw.js" /><link rel="modulepreload" href="/plus-assets/build/assets/client-ChDcy-h8.js" /><link rel="modulepreload" href="/plus-assets/build/assets/index-DTfie-aa.js" /><link rel="modulepreload" href="/plus-assets/build/assets/iframe-CBshCjZa.js" /><script type="module" src="/plus-assets/build/assets/iframe-react-C72_0lsw.js"></script>
<script>
     window.addEventListener('load', () => window.setTimeout(() => {
        const makeLink = (asset) => {
            const link = document.createElement('link')

            Object.keys(asset).forEach((attribute) => {
                link.setAttribute(attribute, asset[attribute])
            })

            return link
        }

        const loadNext = (assets, count) => window.setTimeout(() => {
            if (count > assets.length) {
                count = assets.length

                if (count === 0) {
                    return
                }
            }

            const fragment = new DocumentFragment

            while (count > 0) {
                const link = makeLink(assets.shift())
                fragment.append(link)
                count--

                if (assets.length) {
                    link.onload = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                    link.onerror = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                }
            }

            document.head.append(fragment)
        })

        loadNext([], 3)
    }))

<script>
     window.addEventListener('load', () => window.setTimeout(() => {
        const makeLink = (asset) => {
            const link = document.createElement('link')

            Object.keys(asset).forEach((attribute) => {
                link.setAttribute(attribute, asset[attribute])
            })

            return link
        }

        const loadNext = (assets, count) => window.setTimeout(() => {
            if (count > assets.length) {
                count = assets.length

                if (count === 0) {
                    return
                }
            }

            const fragment = new DocumentFragment

            while (count > 0) {
                const link = makeLink(assets.shift())
                fragment.append(link)
                count--

                if (assets.length) {
                    link.onload = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                    link.onerror = () => loadNext(assets, 1)
                }
            }

            document.head.append(fragment)
        })

        loadNext([], 3)
    }))
